In Indonesia, NAFLD is also becoming an important cause of liver disease-related mortality. According to the GHE 2015 dataset, NAFLD and other causes accounted for 17·4% of all deaths due to cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases, and for 20·9% of those due to liver cancer ( table 2).
1 Data on the prevalence of NAFLD have been scarce in Indonesia.
209 However, risk factors for NAFLD (ie, type 2 diabetes, increased triglycerides, low HDL-cholesterol, and metabolic syndrome exemplified by obesity, type 2 diabetes, hypertension, and increased waist circumference), are prevalent and increasing in Indonesia.
